ygData.subject: FW: [shadowknight] Re: Well, I give up
ygData.msgSnippet: I think you need to put things in perspective. Remember this game maxes out at level 50. In the mid teens you certainly haven t hit your stride. If this game
ygData.messageBody:
I think you need to put things in perspective. Remember this game maxes out
at level 50. In the mid teens you certainly haven't hit your stride. If this
game parallels DnD as much as it appears to have:

Fighters have the advantage at low levels
Cross breeds (Shadow Knights, Paladins) Have the Advantage at mid level
Magic types have the advantage at high levels

Sthiel Cazic-Thule

-----Original Message-----
From: Steven E. Phipps [mailto:phipps@...]
Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 7:38 AM
To: shadowknight@onelist.com
Subject: [shadowknight] Re: Well, I give up


From: "Steven E. Phipps" <phipps@...>

Exactly, I am a dark elf necromancer...
Why is my wife an ogre sk? that is the class we picked to come with me, the
best possible combination we could think of...
She could have made a bard, wizard, warrior, shaman, cleric, whatever...
But we chose a shadow knight..
She just got level 13...
She cracks for 28 a whack with halberd, can invite the mob with impart str,
(which keeps it from coming at me)..
She also uses my skellie the right way, back off, taunts when skellie hurt
bad, etc...plue we got her skellie hitting also...
Then ya got me in the background throwing heat blood, etc..
Awesome combination, the only problem we have is her hitpoints, god, takes
forever for her to heal, i cant wait till she gets lifetap spells, but until
then...
The shamans and clerics need to be needed too....8)
Morgul the Black
P.S. We are saving for banded mail..god is she gonna be mean
----- Original Message -----
From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Saturday, May 01, 1999 5:53 PM
Subject: [shadowknight] Re: Well, I give up


> From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
>
> Even though I do feel, as I'm sure you all know by now, that HT and
> some of the spells do need tweaking, I must defend the SK class.
>
> It has always been said from the beginning that we will NEVER be as
> good a tank or fighter as a Warrior. We will NEVER be as good a caster
> as a Necromancer.
> This should not take you by surprise.
> And you're only level 10? You're still a baby to the class, along with
> myself i will add.
> I have a friend who is level 20 SK and he's a major butt-kicker. We do
> come into our power, but patience and hard work is required.
>
> And if you dont want to role-play the character, you chose the wrong
> line of work.
>
> I am a level 12 Human SK. I have seen the Necromancers I travel with go
> from a level or 2 behind me, to 3 or levels ahead of me. And it is a
> little disheartening. But, this is the curse of the hybrid.
>
> But even these now higher level Necros like a little more muscle in
> between them and the creature wanting to dance on their foreheads. They
> cant cast if they're getting beat on.
> There have been many situations when even their pet has been killed and
> i'm whats left to take the beating. Which i seem to enjoy in a weird
> and twisted way.
> I still save their butts as often as they save mine.
>
> And when they are out of mana and cant cast those spells that we are so
> jealous of and a train or high ranked creature decides to appear? Whos
> left? Us :)
>
> Anyway, in short, 10 is too young to decide. If you dont have the
> patience to wait until you come into your power, then SK is the wrong
> class for you. I can see my powers slowly, but surely rising.
> I have no doubt I WILL be feared.
>
> Bathory
> Cazic-Thule
>
